sentences.sContent: This is popularly called sailing under “jib and jigger”—the jigger being an old square-rigger term for the aft-most mast flying a triangular sail.
sentences.sContent_eng: This is popularly called sailing under “jib and jigger”—the jigger being an old square-rigger term for the aft-most mast flying a triangular sail.
sentences.sCn: 这种航行法常被叫做“jib and jigger”——jigger是对于船尾桅杆上的三角帆的古老叫法。

synos.tran: 踌躇不前；停止不动；移转

words.tran: 改变帆的方向；顺风转向

trans.tranCn: 船首三角帆, 起重机的臂, 挺杆
trans.tranOther: a small sail in front of the large sail on a boat
